excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 10/10
Fandom: Andi Mack (TV)
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Cyrus Goodman/T. J. Kippen
Characters: Cyrus Goodman, T.J. Kippen, Andi Mack, Buffy Driscoll, Jonah Beck, Marty, Amber, Walker, Reed
Additional Tags: Romance, Slow Burn, the theme of this is ‘boys are stupid’
Summary:

“I guess I realised how much I like him, y’know?” Said Cyrus.

TJ quirked an eyebrow at him but didn’t call his bluff. Instead, he just flicked another couple of M&Ms across the table. “I get that,” he said, smiling slightly. “Sometimes crushes come out of nowhere.”

OR

Asking TJ for help in getting his crush’s attention seemed like a great idea at the time, but then again Cyrus had never anticipated that he’d fall for him in the process.

title: The nail polish
body:
This was longer than I intended it to be, but oh well!!

~

There was a small frown on Cyrus’ face as he studied his painted nails.

This was a bad idea, he thought.

He couldn’t wear this to school. Sure, it looked nice, but there was no way people wouldn’t judge him for it. Or worse - figure out he was gay.

Panic started to settle in, and he fled from his room to the bathroom, flinging open the cabinets and rummaging around for nail polish remover. He found a bottle of it that was very nearly empty, and grabbed some cotton pads so he could frantically scrub it all off.

He had to leave for school in 5 minutes, and here he was trying to remove nail polish. Classic Cyrus.

He hastily replaced the bottle when he had finished, and dashed out of the bathroom.

“Cyrus! You ready to go?”

“Yup!” he called back, taking two stairs at a time as he rushed down. There were a few close calls, but he reached the bottom of the staircase unscathed.

Maybe one day he would have the confidence to wear nail polish, but today just wasn’t that day.

~

“Hey Underdog!”

The shorter boy turned around with a bright smile. “Hey! What’s up?”

“Maths.” TJ responded with a shudder. “What about you?”

“Take a guess.”

The athlete gave him a fond smile, before looking down at the books he was holding. “Hmm…could it be Biology?”

“Correct!”

TJ’s eyes lingered on the boy’s hands, and his smile turned curious. “Hey - is that nail polish?”

Cyrus’ eyes widened, and he frantically looked down at his nails. Sure enough, there were remnants of nail polish on not one - but two of his nails.

“No!” he said defensively, shifting his books from his left arm to his right. “Why would I be wearing nail polish?”

The athlete laughed slightly and raised his free arm in surrender. “I don’t know, because it looks cute?”

“Well I’m not.”

“…Okay then. Well - this is where I turn. See you at lunch?”

“Yeah…see you then.”

Cyrus spent the next few periods trying desperately to cover the nail polish remnants - so much so that he could barely pay attention in class. As he found out - writing with his left hand was not a strong suit of his.

He was well aware that straight guys wore nail polish sometimes, but that was definitely not how people would interpret it if he wore nail polish. He knew that for sure.

With this in mind, he hid his right arm under the desk and tried desperately to focus on writing with his left hand.

At lunch in the cafeteria, Cyrus felt arms wrap around his waist from behind. He laughed at first and turned around to greet TJ, but then he noticed a few of the curious looks they were receiving. He cleared his throat and stepped out of the athlete’s grasp.

TJ frowned at that, but he seemed to brush it off. “So…” he began hesitantly. “Wanna sit alone somewhere?”

Cyrus let out a small sigh of relief. “Yeah. I do.”

They found a tucked away corner by an unused part of the basketball court, and settled down there to have lunch.

For a few minutes, there was a tense silence between them.

“There’s nothing wrong with wearing nail polish…you know that right?”

Cyrus looked down at the ground. “It’s not nail polish,” he mumbled. “It’s paint. From art.”

“You don’t do art.”

“How would you know that?”

“I don’t know, maybe because I’m your boyfriend?”

Cyrus just shrugged, and TJ let out a small sigh. He shuffled closer and wrapped a hesitant arm around the boy.

“I don’t like seeing you sad.”

“I’m not sad.”

The athlete gave him a playful nudge. “Right. So is today international ‘deny everything’ day or what?”

Cyrus couldn’t help but laugh slightly. He finally looked over at the other boy, who gave him a heart-melting smile, and placed a hand on his arm. “Okay,” he conceded. “It was nail polish. I wanted to wear some today, but this morning I panicked and tried to take it off. Obviously, I didn’t get all of it. Because I’m me.”

TJ softened at that, and leant over to place a kiss on the boy’s forehead. “Why did you remove it? I didn’t even get to see you looking adorable with nail polish on.”

The shorter boy could feel himself blushing, so he looked bashfully down at the ground again. “I didn’t want people to figure out I was gay. Or say anything about it. I don’t know - I was just scared.”

“Hey,” TJ murmured, gently tilting the boy’s head toward him. “If anyone says anything like that whatsoever, I will beat them up. It’s none of their business whether you’re gay or not.”

Cyrus gave him a pointed look, and he chuckled before adding “Okay - I’ll beat them up with words.”

The shorter boy shook his head in amusement “You’re sweet…but gosh, I feel so stupid right now.”

“Why?”

“Because you’re so…I don’t know, unapologetic? And here I am having a tantrum over nail polish.”

TJ frowned and shook his head. “Everyone’s different. Not giving a fuck about what other people think takes time.”

“I have no idea how you do it.”

“I just think - being gay isn’t a choice, so why should it matter what other people think of me?” he paused for a moment, before smiling sheepishly. “And I guess I can be intimidating sometimes. That probably helps.”

Cyrus laughed and pulled the athlete in, pressing a quick kiss to his cheek. “You’re very cute for someone so intimidating.”

“Yeah?” TJ teased, smiling fondly at his boyfriend.

“Definitely.”

They remained like that for a few moments, before the taller boy playfully nudged Cyrus’ forehead with his own. “How would you feel about wearing nail polish if I wore it too?”

“Hmm…I don’t know. I’m scared you’d rock it better than I would.”

“That’s Impossible.”

Cyrus rolled his eyes, but he couldn’t help a shy smile. “Honestly though, I’m still not sure if I could. You definitely should though…if you want to.”

“Okay…but promise me one day we’ll rock nail polish together?”

“One day.” Cyrus promised, leaning his head on the boy’s shoulder.

~

Later on, Cyrus and Andi couldn’t make it to The Spoon, which left TJ sitting alone with Buffy and Marty.

“So where you and Cyrus at lunch?” Buffy asked him.

TJ hesitated for a moment, glancing nervously around the diner. “Um…he was kinda upset, so I asked him if he wanted to sit alone with me.”

Marty frowned. “What was he upset about?”

“Um…”

Should he tell them? They were both pretty close to Cyrus, so it couldn’t hurt. Could it?

Buffy in particular looked very protective at that moment, and TJ knew instantly that she’d end up confronting Cyrus about it if he didn’t tell her.

“Basically…he wanted to wear nail polish today, but he ended up removing it because he was scared of what people at school might think. We talked about it though.”

Buffy slowly shook her head. “If anyone were to say anything about him wearing nail polish, I’d kill them.”

TJ laughed slightly. “I know - same here. That’s what I told him.”

“Do you think he’d be more comfortable if he saw me wearing nail polish?” Marty asked.

TJ gave him a surprised look, but he smiled eagerly and nodded all the same. “It wouldn’t hurt, that’s for sure. I was planning on doing the same thing tomorrow actually.”

“Sweet! I’ll steal some of my sister’s.”

Buffy gave him a fond look, before turning to TJ with a smile. “I could wear some too…although I’m not sure if it would have the same effect.”

“Psh, everything counts. We could totally be a nail polish trio.”

Marty laughed. “That sounds dope! Obviously though - we’d have to coordinate our colours.”

“You’re right. Pink, purple and blue?”

“That’s basic.” Buffy argued. “Yellow, pink and blue is a much more interesting combo.”

TJ rolled his eyes and turned to Marty, clearly trying to get his opinion.

The boy just laughed again. “Who am I to argue with my girlfriend? Yellow, pink and blue sounds good.”

“You argue with her all the time.” TJ pointed out.

“It’s banter,” he corrected. “And it’s cute.”

“Whatever. I have dibs on pink.”

“I have dibs on blue!” Buffy added.

“Alright, well jokes on you guys, because yellow is superior anyway!”

TJ rolled his eyes again. “We’ll see about that.”

~

The following day, Cyrus walked up to his locker with fully clear nails - he could officially go back to writing with his right hand, and he had never been so thankful.

After dumping his bag in his locker and collecting his things, he turned to find TJ in front of him. He glanced down for a moment, double-taking when he noticed the boy’s nail polish.

Was TJ actually wearing pink nail polish, or was Cyrus just seeing things?

He glanced up at the boy’s face, before looking back down at his nails.

Okay yeah - he was definitely wearing pink nail polish. And it looked far too good to be allowed.

“Hey.” he breathed.

“Hey. What’s up?”

“Your cuteness, apparently. That shade of pink is awesome!”

TJ laughed as they began to head to class. “Thanks, Underdog.”

Aside from the occasional curious glance, TJ’s nail polish went relatively unnoticed as they walked through the corridors. Cyrus ended up reasoning that TJ was pretty popular - people probably just didn’t want to get on his bad side.

At lunch, Buffy and Andi were waiting for him by his locker. As he opened it, he excitedly told the pair about a movie he had watched the night before.

“So in the end, the mean girl got redeemed! Serious guys, it was great, and - hang on - Buffy, are you wearing nail polish?”

She shrugged. “I don’t know. Am I?”

“Um - you absolutely are - and it looks amazing! I didn’t realise you were a nail polish type of gal!”

“She’s not the only one.”

Cyrus whirled around to find Marty standing there, casually pushing back his hair. Sure enough - his nails were painted a vibrant yellow.

So straightest guy he knew was wearing nail polish…and no one was giving him weird looks? 

He gaped at the boy for a moment or two, before blushing slightly and smiling wide. “Wow, I didn’t realise nail polish was your thing either. But…it looks good on you!”

“Thanks, Cyrus.”

“…Has anyone said anything about it?”

Marty shook his head. “No, not really. A few people told me they liked the colour, but that’s it.”

“Whoa.”

“Cool, right?”

Cyrus gave him an amazed look as TJ approached them, a knowing smile on his lips.

“Hey Cyrus.”

“Did you three coordinate this?!”

The athlete laughed and wrapped a casual arm around the boy’s shoulders. “Maybe. What do you think?”

Cyrus looked down at the ground, a light blush tinging his cheeks. “You all look good.” he mumbled.

TJ beamed and resisted the sudden urge to kiss his boyfriend on the cheek. Instead - he began guiding him towards the cafeteria.

“Pink looks cute on you.” Cyrus commented.

The athlete gave him a playful smile. “You think so?”

“Definitely.”

Cyrus could feel their hands brushing as he walked, and it took all of his restraint not to just reach out and take the boy’s hand.

One look at TJ confirmed that he was likely thinking the same thing, if his glances towards their hands were anything to go by.

A few moments passed, and Cyrus was very seriously considering just taking his hand and being done with it. He hesitated, but slowly, he slipped in hand into TJ’s.

The boy’s eyes widened, and he looked over at Cyrus in alarm. “Are you sure?” whispered. “I really don’t think we can pass this off as a ‘friend’ thing.”

“I’m sure. As long as I have you guys, I’m good.” he hesitated again for a moment, before wincing slightly. “But…do you think we’ll get bullied?”

“I am the bully.” TJ reminded him.

“The ex-bully.” Cyrus corrected.

“Still - people are scared of me. They wouldn’t dare go near my adorable boyfriend.”

Cyrus giggled at that as they sat down. “I still can’t believe people are scared of a giant teddy bear like you.”

Marty scoffed as he and Buffy sat down next to them. “He’s only a teddy bear around you, dude.”

“Yeah,” Buffy agreed. “Around other people, he‘s the polar opposite of a teddy bear. I’m not sure what that is, but he’s it.”

Andi laughed as her and Amber took a seat across from them. “Why exactly are we talking about teddy bears?”

“Very good question.” TJ remarked.

As various conversations started up, Cyrus couldn’t help but sneak glances at Andi and Amber. Amber had a casual arm around the girl’s waist, and occasionally she would kiss Andi’s cheek, or call her cute, or do something that clearly hinted at their relationship.

They didn’t seem to get trouble from people…so maybe he and TJ wouldn’t either? Then again, maybe people thought they were just ridiculously close friends. Ridiculously close friends who kissed sometimes.

“Earth to Cyrus?”

“Hmm?”

He looked over at his boyfriend, and couldn’t help but blush slightly at the way TJ was gazing at him.

“Gosh, you’re killing me.” the athlete mumbled. “Who gave you the right to be so cute?”

Okay. Cyrus could definitely feel his face burning now.

“Well…who gave you the right to be so sweet?”

“Isn’t that in the job description for being your boyfriend?”

“I didn’t realise there was a job description.”

The boy grinned. “Oh - there definitely is. I’ve read it, and it clearly says that Cyrus Goodman’s boyfriend must be sweet to him, because he deserves all the sweetness in the world.”

Cyrus beamed as he moved forward to engulf TJ in a hug, burying his face in the boy’s jumper.

“You’ve broken him, TJ.” Marty commented.

TJ just laughed and rested his chin atop of Cyrus’ head. “It’s okay - give him a few minutes and he’ll be good.”

~

That afternoon, after spending a few hours agonising over the idea, Cyrus finally decided he would wear nail polish to school the next day.

Cyrus: Come over and help me paint my nails for tomorrow? :)

TJ: I’ll be there asap! xx

He had to leave for school in 5 minutes, and here he was trying to remove nail polish. Classic Cyrus.

He hastily replaced the bottle when he had finished, and dashed out of the bathroom.

“Cyrus! You ready to go?”

“Yup!” he called back, taking two stairs at a time as he rushed down. There were a few close calls, but he reached the bottom of the staircase unscathed.

Maybe one day he would have the confidence to wear nail polish, but today just wasn’t that day.

~

“Hey Underdog!”

The shorter boy turned around with a bright smile. “Hey! What’s up?”

“Maths.” TJ responded with a shudder. “What about you?”

“Take a guess.”

The athlete gave him a fond smile, before looking down at the books he was holding. “Hmm…could it be Biology?”

“Correct!”

TJ’s eyes lingered on the boy’s hands, and his smile turned curious. “Hey - is that nail polish?”

Cyrus’ eyes widened, and he frantically looked down at his nails. Sure enough, there were remnants of nail polish on not one - but two of his nails.

“No!” he said defensively, shifting his books from his left arm to his right. “Why would I be wearing nail polish?”

The athlete laughed slightly and raised his free arm in surrender. “I don’t know, because it looks cute?”

“Well I’m not.”

“…Okay then. Well - this is where I turn. See you at lunch?”

“Yeah…see you then.”

Cyrus spent the next few periods trying desperately to cover the nail polish remnants - so much so that he could barely pay attention in class. As he found out - writing with his left hand was not a strong suit of his.

He was well aware that straight guys wore nail polish sometimes, but that was definitely not how people would interpret it if he wore nail polish. He knew that for sure.

With this in mind, he hid his right arm under the desk and tried desperately to focus on writing with his left hand.

At lunch in the cafeteria, Cyrus felt arms wrap around his waist from behind. He laughed at first and turned around to greet TJ, but then he noticed a few of the curious looks they were receiving. He cleared his throat and stepped out of the athlete’s grasp.

TJ frowned at that, but he seemed to brush it off. “So…” he began hesitantly. “Wanna sit alone somewhere?”

Cyrus let out a small sigh of relief. “Yeah. I do.”

They found a tucked away corner by an unused part of the basketball court, and settled down there to have lunch.

[[MORE]]

For a few minutes, there was a tense silence between them.

“There’s nothing wrong with wearing nail polish…you know that right?”

Cyrus looked down at the ground. “It’s not nail polish,” he mumbled. “It’s paint. From art.”

“You don’t do art.”

“How would you know that?”

“I don’t know, maybe because I’m your boyfriend?”

Cyrus just shrugged, and TJ let out a small sigh. He shuffled closer and wrapped a hesitant arm around the boy.

“I don’t like seeing you sad.”

“I’m not sad.”

The athlete gave him a playful nudge. “Right. So is today international ‘deny everything’ day or what?”

Cyrus couldn’t help but laugh slightly. He finally looked over at the other boy, who gave him a heart-melting smile, and placed a hand on his arm. “Okay,” he conceded. “It was nail polish. I wanted to wear some today, but this morning I panicked and tried to take it off. Obviously, I didn’t get all of it. Because I’m me.”

TJ softened at that, and leant over to place a kiss on the boy’s forehead. “Why did you remove it? I didn’t even get to see you looking adorable with nail polish on.”

The shorter boy could feel himself blushing, so he looked bashfully down at the ground again. “I didn’t want people to figure out I was gay. Or say anything about it. I don’t know - I was just scared.”

“Hey,” TJ murmured, gently tilting the boy’s head toward him. “If anyone says anything like that whatsoever, I will beat them up. It’s none of their business whether you’re gay or not.”

Cyrus gave him a pointed look, and he chuckled before adding “Okay - I’ll beat them up with words.”

The shorter boy shook his head in amusement “You’re sweet…but gosh, I feel so stupid right now.”

“Why?”

“Because you’re so…I don’t know, unapologetic? And here I am having a tantrum over nail polish.”

TJ frowned and shook his head. “Everyone’s different. Not giving a fuck about what other people think takes time.”

“I have no idea how you do it.”

“I just think - being gay isn’t a choice, so why should it matter what other people think of me?” he paused for a moment, before smiling sheepishly. “And I guess I can be intimidating sometimes. That probably helps.”

Cyrus laughed and pulled the athlete in, pressing a quick kiss to his cheek. “You’re very cute for someone so intimidating.”

“Yeah?” TJ teased, smiling fondly at his boyfriend.

“Definitely.”

They remained like that for a few moments, before the taller boy playfully nudged Cyrus’ forehead with his own. “How would you feel about wearing nail polish if I wore it too?”

“Hmm…I don’t know. I’m scared you’d rock it better than I would.”

“That’s Impossible.”

Cyrus rolled his eyes, but he couldn’t help a shy smile. “Honestly though, I’m still not sure if I could. You definitely should though…if you want to.”

“Okay…but promise me one day we’ll rock nail polish together?”

“One day.” Cyrus promised, leaning his head on the boy’s shoulder.

~

Later on, Cyrus and Andi couldn’t make it to The Spoon, which left TJ sitting alone with Buffy and Marty.

“So where you and Cyrus at lunch?” Buffy asked him.

TJ hesitated for a moment, glancing nervously around the diner. “Um…he was kinda upset, so I asked him if he wanted to sit alone with me.”

Marty frowned. “What was he upset about?”

“Um…”

Should he tell them? They were both pretty close to Cyrus, so it couldn’t hurt. Could it?

Buffy in particular looked very protective at that moment, and TJ knew instantly that she’d end up confronting Cyrus about it if he didn’t tell her.

“Basically…he wanted to wear nail polish today, but he ended up removing it because he was scared of what people at school might think. We talked about it though.”

Buffy slowly shook her head. “If anyone were to say anything about him wearing nail polish, I’d kill them.”

TJ laughed slightly. “I know - same here. That’s what I told him.”

“Do you think he’d be more comfortable if he saw me wearing nail polish?” Marty asked.

TJ gave him a surprised look, but he smiled eagerly and nodded all the same. “It wouldn’t hurt, that’s for sure. I was planning on doing the same thing tomorrow actually.”

“Sweet! I’ll steal some of my sister’s.”

Buffy gave him a fond look, before turning to TJ with a smile. “I could wear some too…although I’m not sure if it would have the same effect.”

“Psh, everything counts. We could totally be a nail polish trio.”

Marty laughed. “That sounds dope! Obviously though - we’d have to coordinate our colours.”

“You’re right. Pink, purple and blue?”

“That’s basic.” Buffy argued. “Yellow, pink and blue is a much more interesting combo.”

TJ rolled his eyes and turned to Marty, clearly trying to get his opinion.

The boy just laughed again. “Who am I to argue with my girlfriend? Yellow, pink and blue sounds good.”

“You argue with her all the time.” TJ pointed out.

“It’s banter,” he corrected. “And it’s cute.”

“Whatever. I have dibs on pink.”

“I have dibs on blue!” Buffy added.

“Alright, well jokes on you guys, because yellow is superior anyway!”

TJ rolled his eyes again. “We’ll see about that.”

~

The following day, Cyrus walked up to his locker with fully clear nails - he could officially go back to writing with his right hand, and he had never been so thankful.

After dumping his bag in his locker and collecting his things, he turned to find TJ in front of him. He glanced down for a moment, double-taking when he noticed the boy’s nail polish.

Was TJ actually wearing pink nail polish, or was Cyrus just seeing things?

He glanced up at the boy’s face, before looking back down at his nails.

Okay yeah - he was definitely wearing pink nail polish. And it looked far too good to be allowed.

“Hey.” he breathed.

“Hey. What’s up?”

“Your cuteness, apparently. That shade of pink is awesome!”

TJ laughed as they began to head to class. “Thanks, Underdog.”

Aside from the occasional curious glance, TJ’s nail polish went relatively unnoticed as they walked through the corridors. Cyrus ended up reasoning that TJ was pretty popular - people probably just didn’t want to get on his bad side.

At lunch, Buffy and Andi were waiting for him by his locker. As he opened it, he excitedly told the pair about a movie he had watched the night before.

“So in the end, the mean girl got redeemed! Serious guys, it was great, and - hang on - Buffy, are you wearing nail polish?”

She shrugged. “I don’t know. Am I?”

“Um - you absolutely are - and it looks amazing! I didn’t realise you were a nail polish type of gal!”

“She’s not the only one.”

Cyrus whirled around to find Marty standing there, casually pushing back his hair. Sure enough - his nails were painted a vibrant yellow.

So straightest guy he knew was wearing nail polish…and no one was giving him weird looks? 

He gaped at the boy for a moment or two, before blushing slightly and smiling wide. “Wow, I didn’t realise nail polish was your thing either. But…it looks good on you!”

“Thanks, Cyrus.”

“…Has anyone said anything about it?”

Marty shook his head. “No, not really. A few people told me they liked the colour, but that’s it.”

“Whoa.”

“Cool, right?”

Cyrus gave him an amazed look as TJ approached them, a knowing smile on his lips.

“Hey Cyrus.”

“Did you three coordinate this?!”

The athlete laughed and wrapped a casual arm around the boy’s shoulders. “Maybe. What do you think?”

Cyrus looked down at the ground, a light blush tinging his cheeks. “You all look good.” he mumbled.

TJ beamed and resisted the sudden urge to kiss his boyfriend on the cheek. Instead - he began guiding him towards the cafeteria.

“Pink looks cute on you.” Cyrus commented.

The athlete gave him a playful smile. “You think so?”

“Definitely.”

Cyrus could feel their hands brushing as he walked, and it took all of his restraint not to just reach out and take the boy’s hand.

One look at TJ confirmed that he was likely thinking the same thing, if his glances towards their hands were anything to go by.

A few moments passed, and Cyrus was very seriously considering just taking his hand and being done with it. He hesitated, but slowly, he slipped in hand into TJ’s.

The boy’s eyes widened, and he looked over at Cyrus in alarm. “Are you sure?” whispered. “I really don’t think we can pass this off as a ‘friend’ thing.”

“I’m sure. As long as I have you guys, I’m good.” he hesitated again for a moment, before wincing slightly. “But…do you think we’ll get bullied?”

“I am the bully.” TJ reminded him.

“The ex-bully.” Cyrus corrected.

“Still - people are scared of me. They wouldn’t dare go near my adorable boyfriend.”

Cyrus giggled at that as they sat down. “I still can’t believe people are scared of a giant teddy bear like you.”

Marty scoffed as he and Buffy sat down next to them. “He’s only a teddy bear around you, dude.”

“Yeah,” Buffy agreed. “Around other people, he‘s the polar opposite of a teddy bear. I’m not sure what that is, but he’s it.”

Andi laughed as her and Amber took a seat across from them. “Why exactly are we talking about teddy bears?”

“Very good question.” TJ remarked.

As various conversations started up, Cyrus couldn’t help but sneak glances at Andi and Amber. Amber had a casual arm around the girl’s waist, and occasionally she would kiss Andi’s cheek, or call her cute, or do something that clearly hinted at their relationship.

They didn’t seem to get trouble from people…so maybe he and TJ wouldn’t either? Then again, maybe people thought they were just ridiculously close friends. Ridiculously close friends who kissed sometimes.

“Earth to Cyrus?”

“Hmm?”

He looked over at his boyfriend, and couldn’t help but blush slightly at the way TJ was gazing at him.

“Gosh, you’re killing me.” the athlete mumbled. “Who gave you the right to be so cute?”

Okay. Cyrus could definitely feel his face burning now.

“Well…who gave you the right to be so sweet?”

“Isn’t that in the job description for being your boyfriend?”

“I didn’t realise there was a job description.”

The boy grinned. “Oh - there definitely is. I’ve read it, and it clearly says that Cyrus Goodman’s boyfriend must be sweet to him, because he deserves all the sweetness in the world.”

Cyrus beamed as he moved forward to engulf TJ in a hug, burying his face in the boy’s jumper.

“You’ve broken him, TJ.” Marty commented.

TJ just laughed and rested his chin atop of Cyrus’ head. “It’s okay - give him a few minutes and he’ll be good.”

~

That afternoon, after spending a few hours agonising over the idea, Cyrus finally decided he would wear nail polish to school the next day.

Cyrus: Come over and help me paint my nails for tomorrow? :)

TJ: I’ll be there asap! xx

Cyrus looked down at the ground. “It’s not nail polish,” he mumbled. “It’s paint. From art.”

“You don’t do art.”

“How would you know that?”

“I don’t know, maybe because I’m your boyfriend?”

Cyrus just shrugged, and TJ let out a small sigh. He shuffled closer and wrapped a hesitant arm around the boy.

“I don’t like seeing you sad.”

“I’m not sad.”

The athlete gave him a playful nudge. “Right. So is today international ‘deny everything’ day or what?”

Cyrus couldn’t help but laugh slightly. He finally looked over at the other boy, who gave him a heart-melting smile, and placed a hand on his arm. “Okay,” he conceded. “It was nail polish. I wanted to wear some today, but this morning I panicked and tried to take it off. Obviously, I didn’t get all of it. Because I’m me.”

TJ softened at that, and leant over to place a kiss on the boy’s forehead. “Why did you remove it? I didn’t even get to see you looking adorable with nail polish on.”

The shorter boy could feel himself blushing, so he looked bashfully down at the ground again. “I didn’t want people to figure out I was gay. Or say anything about it. I don’t know - I was just scared.”

“Hey,” TJ murmured, gently tilting the boy’s head toward him. “If anyone says anything like that whatsoever, I will beat them up. It’s none of their business whether you’re gay or not.”

Cyrus gave him a pointed look, and he chuckled before adding “Okay - I’ll beat them up with words.”

The shorter boy shook his head in amusement “You’re sweet…but gosh, I feel so stupid right now.”

“Why?”

“Because you’re so…I don’t know, unapologetic? And here I am having a tantrum over nail polish.”

TJ frowned and shook his head. “Everyone’s different. Not giving a fuck about what other people think takes time.”

“I have no idea how you do it.”

“I just think - being gay isn’t a choice, so why should it matter what other people think of me?” he paused for a moment, before smiling sheepishly. “And I guess I can be intimidating sometimes. That probably helps.”

Cyrus laughed and pulled the athlete in, pressing a quick kiss to his cheek. “You’re very cute for someone so intimidating.”

“Yeah?” TJ teased, smiling fondly at his boyfriend.

“Definitely.”

They remained like that for a few moments, before the taller boy playfully nudged Cyrus’ forehead with his own. “How would you feel about wearing nail polish if I wore it too?”

“Hmm…I don’t know. I’m scared you’d rock it better than I would.”

“That’s Impossible.”

Cyrus rolled his eyes, but he couldn’t help a shy smile. “Honestly though, I’m still not sure if I could. You definitely should though…if you want to.”

“Okay…but promise me one day we’ll rock nail polish together?”

“One day.” Cyrus promised, leaning his head on the boy’s shoulder.

~

Later on, Cyrus and Andi couldn’t make it to The Spoon, which left TJ sitting alone with Buffy and Marty.

“So where you and Cyrus at lunch?” Buffy asked him.

TJ hesitated for a moment, glancing nervously around the diner. “Um…he was kinda upset, so I asked him if he wanted to sit alone with me.”

Marty frowned. “What was he upset about?”

“Um…”

Should he tell them? They were both pretty close to Cyrus, so it couldn’t hurt. Could it?

Buffy in particular looked very protective at that moment, and TJ knew instantly that she’d end up confronting Cyrus about it if he didn’t tell her.

“Basically…he wanted to wear nail polish today, but he ended up removing it because he was scared of what people at school might think. We talked about it though.”

Buffy slowly shook her head. “If anyone were to say anything about him wearing nail polish, I’d kill them.”

TJ laughed slightly. “I know - same here. That’s what I told him.”

“Do you think he’d be more comfortable if he saw me wearing nail polish?” Marty asked.

TJ gave him a surprised look, but he smiled eagerly and nodded all the same. “It wouldn’t hurt, that’s for sure. I was planning on doing the same thing tomorrow actually.”

“Sweet! I’ll steal some of my sister’s.”

Buffy gave him a fond look, before turning to TJ with a smile. “I could wear some too…although I’m not sure if it would have the same effect.”

“Psh, everything counts. We could totally be a nail polish trio.”

Marty laughed. “That sounds dope! Obviously though - we’d have to coordinate our colours.”

“You’re right. Pink, purple and blue?”

“That’s basic.” Buffy argued. “Yellow, pink and blue is a much more interesting combo.”

TJ rolled his eyes and turned to Marty, clearly trying to get his opinion.

The boy just laughed again. “Who am I to argue with my girlfriend? Yellow, pink and blue sounds good.”

“You argue with her all the time.” TJ pointed out.

“It’s banter,” he corrected. “And it’s cute.”

“Whatever. I have dibs on pink.”

“I have dibs on blue!” Buffy added.

“Alright, well jokes on you guys, because yellow is superior anyway!”

TJ rolled his eyes again. “We’ll see about that.”

~

The following day, Cyrus walked up to his locker with fully clear nails - he could officially go back to writing with his right hand, and he had never been so thankful.

After dumping his bag in his locker and collecting his things, he turned to find TJ in front of him. He glanced down for a moment, double-taking when he noticed the boy’s nail polish.

Was TJ actually wearing pink nail polish, or was Cyrus just seeing things?

He glanced up at the boy’s face, before looking back down at his nails.

Okay yeah - he was definitely wearing pink nail polish. And it looked far too good to be allowed.

“Hey.” he breathed.

“Hey. What’s up?”

“Your cuteness, apparently. That shade of pink is awesome!”

TJ laughed as they began to head to class. “Thanks, Underdog.”

Aside from the occasional curious glance, TJ’s nail polish went relatively unnoticed as they walked through the corridors. Cyrus ended up reasoning that TJ was pretty popular - people probably just didn’t want to get on his bad side.

At lunch, Buffy and Andi were waiting for him by his locker. As he opened it, he excitedly told the pair about a movie he had watched the night before.

“So in the end, the mean girl got redeemed! Serious guys, it was great, and - hang on - Buffy, are you wearing nail polish?”

She shrugged. “I don’t know. Am I?”

“Um - you absolutely are - and it looks amazing! I didn’t realise you were a nail polish type of gal!”

“She’s not the only one.”

Cyrus whirled around to find Marty standing there, casually pushing back his hair. Sure enough - his nails were painted a vibrant yellow.

So straightest guy he knew was wearing nail polish…and no one was giving him weird looks? 

He gaped at the boy for a moment or two, before blushing slightly and smiling wide. “Wow, I didn’t realise nail polish was your thing either. But…it looks good on you!”

“Thanks, Cyrus.”

“…Has anyone said anything about it?”

Marty shook his head. “No, not really. A few people told me they liked the colour, but that’s it.”

“Whoa.”

“Cool, right?”

Cyrus gave him an amazed look as TJ approached them, a knowing smile on his lips.

“Hey Cyrus.”

“Did you three coordinate this?!”

The athlete laughed and wrapped a casual arm around the boy’s shoulders. “Maybe. What do you think?”

Cyrus looked down at the ground, a light blush tinging his cheeks. “You all look good.” he mumbled.

TJ beamed and resisted the sudden urge to kiss his boyfriend on the cheek. Instead - he began guiding him towards the cafeteria.

“Pink looks cute on you.” Cyrus commented.

The athlete gave him a playful smile. “You think so?”

“Definitely.”

Cyrus could feel their hands brushing as he walked, and it took all of his restraint not to just reach out and take the boy’s hand.

One look at TJ confirmed that he was likely thinking the same thing, if his glances towards their hands were anything to go by.

A few moments passed, and Cyrus was very seriously considering just taking his hand and being done with it. He hesitated, but slowly, he slipped in hand into TJ’s.

The boy’s eyes widened, and he looked over at Cyrus in alarm. “Are you sure?” whispered. “I really don’t think we can pass this off as a ‘friend’ thing.”

“I’m sure. As long as I have you guys, I’m good.” he hesitated again for a moment, before wincing slightly. “But…do you think we’ll get bullied?”

“I am the bully.” TJ reminded him.

“The ex-bully.” Cyrus corrected.

“Still - people are scared of me. They wouldn’t dare go near my adorable boyfriend.”

Cyrus giggled at that as they sat down. “I still can’t believe people are scared of a giant teddy bear like you.”

Marty scoffed as he and Buffy sat down next to them. “He’s only a teddy bear around you, dude.”

“Yeah,” Buffy agreed. “Around other people, he‘s the polar opposite of a teddy bear. I’m not sure what that is, but he’s it.”

Andi laughed as her and Amber took a seat across from them. “Why exactly are we talking about teddy bears?”

“Very good question.” TJ remarked.

As various conversations started up, Cyrus couldn’t help but sneak glances at Andi and Amber. Amber had a casual arm around the girl’s waist, and occasionally she would kiss Andi’s cheek, or call her cute, or do something that clearly hinted at their relationship.

They didn’t seem to get trouble from people…so maybe he and TJ wouldn’t either? Then again, maybe people thought they were just ridiculously close friends. Ridiculously close friends who kissed sometimes.

“Earth to Cyrus?”

“Hmm?”

He looked over at his boyfriend, and couldn’t help but blush slightly at the way TJ was gazing at him.

“Gosh, you’re killing me.” the athlete mumbled. “Who gave you the right to be so cute?”

Okay. Cyrus could definitely feel his face burning now.

“Well…who gave you the right to be so sweet?”

“Isn’t that in the job description for being your boyfriend?”

“I didn’t realise there was a job description.”

The boy grinned. “Oh - there definitely is. I’ve read it, and it clearly says that Cyrus Goodman’s boyfriend must be sweet to him, because he deserves all the sweetness in the world.”

Cyrus beamed as he moved forward to engulf TJ in a hug, burying his face in the boy’s jumper.

“You’ve broken him, TJ.” Marty commented.

TJ just laughed and rested his chin atop of Cyrus’ head. “It’s okay - give him a few minutes and he’ll be good.”

~

That afternoon, after spending a few hours agonising over the idea, Cyrus finally decided he would wear nail polish to school the next day.

Cyrus: Come over and help me paint my nails for tomorrow? :)

TJ: I’ll be there asap! xx
trail.content_abstract:
This was longer than I intended it to be, but oh well!!

~

There was a small frown on Cyrus’ face as he studied his painted nails.

This was a bad idea, he thought.

He couldn’t wear this to school. Sure, it looked nice, but there was no way people wouldn’t judge him for it. Or worse - figure out he was gay.

Panic started to settle in, and he fled from his room to the bathroom, flinging open the cabinets and rummaging around for nail polish remover. He found a bottle of it that was very nearly empty, and grabbed some cotton pads so he could frantically scrub it all off.

He had to leave for school in 5 minutes, and here he was trying to remove nail polish. Classic Cyrus.

He hastily replaced the bottle when he had finished, and dashed out of the bathroom.

“Cyrus! You ready to go?”

“Yup!” he called back, taking two stairs at a time as he rushed down. There were a few close calls, but he reached the bottom of the staircase unscathed.

Maybe one day he would have the confidence to wear nail polish, but today just wasn’t that day.

~

“Hey Underdog!”

The shorter boy turned around with a bright smile. “Hey! What’s up?”

“Maths.” TJ responded with a shudder. “What about you?”

“Take a guess.”

The athlete gave him a fond smile, before looking down at the books he was holding. “Hmm…could it be Biology?”

“Correct!”

TJ’s eyes lingered on the boy’s hands, and his smile turned curious. “Hey - is that nail polish?”

Cyrus’ eyes widened, and he frantically looked down at his nails. Sure enough, there were remnants of nail polish on not one - but two of his nails.

“No!” he said defensively, shifting his books from his left arm to his right. “Why would I be wearing nail polish?”

The athlete laughed slightly and raised his free arm in surrender. “I don’t know, because it looks cute?”

“Well I’m not.”

“…Okay then. Well - this is where I turn. See you at lunch?”

“Yeah…see you then.”

Cyrus spent the next few periods trying desperately to cover the nail polish remnants - so much so that he could barely pay attention in class. As he found out - writing with his left hand was not a strong suit of his.

He was well aware that straight guys wore nail polish sometimes, but that was definitely not how people would interpret it if he wore nail polish. He knew that for sure.

With this in mind, he hid his right arm under the desk and tried desperately to focus on writing with his left hand.

At lunch in the cafeteria, Cyrus felt arms wrap around his waist from behind. He laughed at first and turned around to greet TJ, but then he noticed a few of the curious looks they were receiving. He cleared his throat and stepped out of the athlete’s grasp.

TJ frowned at that, but he seemed to brush it off. “So…” he began hesitantly. “Wanna sit alone somewhere?”

Cyrus let out a small sigh of relief. “Yeah. I do.”

They found a tucked away corner by an unused part of the basketball court, and settled down there to have lunch.

body:
Nightmares and an unexpected outcome

“When Tj is woken up by the sound of Cyrus crying from a nightmare, his priority is to make the other boy feel safe, even though it might mean letting certain feelings slip.”

Ao3 link

—

Tj had always been a light sleeper, waking up at the smallest sounds or movements. He’d always found it annoying, waking up at times when he didn’t want to, and never managing to go back to sleep, So, it didn’t take much for Tj to wake up at 3am one night when he heard silent sobs coming from the mattress on the floor.

Cyrus was spending the night at Tj’s, which had become quite a tradition for the two. They’d always stay up late and play games, watch movies and talk about everything between heaven and earth (with a few exceptions of course, Tj never mentioned his heart-aching, painful, unrequited crush on the other boy). His favorite part about the sleepovers had always been watching movies, because if he was lucky, Cyrus would get tired and slowly but surely get closer to Tj. In the end, he’d be leaning against Tj completely with his head on his shoulder and their legs intertwined. It was almost like cuddling, and Tj secretly adored it.

As soon as Tj came to his senses, he realized that Cyrus was crying. Feeling panic spread to his body, he whispered a quiet “Hey, Cyrus.”, and awaited an answer. Cyrus turned around to face Tj, and even in the dark, Tj could see Cyrus’ teary eyes.

“Sorry, I didn’t mean to wake you.” He whispered back, probably thinking that he had annoyed Tj by waking him up in the middle of the night. Tj, on the other hand, was just concerned for the other boy’s feelings. He immediately shook his head, not wanting Cyrus to think that he was being a burden.

“Cyrus, no, it’s fine. Is everything okay?” He asked, voice soft and caring. “I heard you crying, I don’t want you to be upset.” Cyrus managed to smile, and sniffled before answering, “Yeah, I’m okay. I just had a nightmare, that’s all.”

“Do you want to talk about it? You know I’m a great listener.”

“Not really, it was just a normal nightmare. Thanks though.”

Before Tj could think, he lifted up his duvet and motioned for Cyrus lay next to him. As soon as his mind caught up with his body though, he had an internal panic attack because what was he doing? He faked a cough and tried to explain himself, “I mean, you could lay here, if you want. Only if you want to, though. But I was thinking that you might feel safer up here? I don’t want you to be scared.” Tj held his breath while he waited for Cyrus to answer, he was afraid that he’d said something wrong or too revealing of his crush.

“Really?” Cyrus asked. “I mean, I want to, but I wouldn’t want to make you uncomfortable.”

Tj smiled, realizing that maybe he didn’t screw up after all, and assured Cyrus that no, he wouldn’t be uncomfortable. After all, he was the one who asked in the first place. Cyrus face broke into a smile as he got up from the mattress on the floor and went to lay down next to Tj. He made sure not to lay too close to him though, considering the two were just friends, and he didn’t want Tj to think he was into him or something. Even if that was the case, Tj didn’t need to know that. No way he’d ever feel the same.

“Are you going to be okay?” Tj asked as before getting ready to fall back asleep. Cyrus turned around to face Tj and smiled, said “Thank you.” and “I think so.” before turning back around and closing his eyes.

It didn’t take long before they fell back to sleep, both a little bit happier than the first time they’d gone to bed that night.

___

Just a while later, Tj was once again woken up by the sound of Cyrus crying. His heart broke at the sound of Cyrus’ crying, and he put a hand on his shoulder to comfort him.

“Cyrus, what’s going on? Are you having nightmares again?” Tj asked, this time even more concerned. Cyrus turned around, upset at the thought of waking Tj up again, and managed to get out a quiet “Yeah.”

“Do you still not want to talk about it?”

“No, I’d rather not, they’re just nightmares and I don’t know why I keep having them.” He paused for a while, before continuing. “I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to be such a baby.”

Tj was quick to assure him that he didn’t think of him that way. “Cyrus, crying does not make you a baby, it makes you brave. I don’t ever want you to feel like you have to hide stuff from me, nothing can make me think any differently of you.”

Cyrus couldn’t help but break out into a huge grin at that, and for a little while, they just faced each other and examined every part of the other’s face, a comfortable silence filling the room.

After a while, Tj broke the silence. “I look up to you and admire you so much, you know that, right?” He almost regretted saying it as soon as the words left his mouth, but he realized that there was no point in hiding it. After all, it was true.

“You do?”

“Well, yeah. Just thought you should know. I feel like people don’t tell you that enough.”

After another moment of silence, Cyrus felt his screw it instincts kick in and he decided to do something he’d longed for for a long time. He leaned forward and closed the gap between him and Tj by pressing his lips against his. At first, Tj was caught off guard, but as soon as he realized what was happening, he happily melted into the kiss. As soon as they broke apart, both boys smiled at each other.

“Woah.” Was all that Tj managed to get out.

“I’ve wanted to do that for a while now.” Cyrus shyly admitted. Tj couldn’t quite comprehend what was happening, as he was too focused on not letting out a scream of excitement ,“Well, I’m glad you did, because so have I.”

“You might as well kiss me again, then.” Cyrus said through a huge grin. Tj, who was smiling just as big, leaned in and pressed his lips against Cyrus’ now familiar ones.

As they parted, Cyrus let out a little laugh. Tj furrowed his eyebrows and looked at him questioningly. “That’s not quite the outcome I expected from having nightmares.” Cyrus said and chuckled. Tj did the same, because this was really not how he expected their sleepover to end. Cyrus yawned, and Tj noticed that he was quite tired, too. They’d both woken up in the middle of the night, so it was no surprise that they were sleepy.

“Are you okay to go back to sleep?” Tj asked, to which Cyrus nodded. Cyrus hesitated before asking “Tj? Can you… um, hold me?” He was happy that the lights were off, so Tj couldn’t see the blush spreading across his cheeks. Little did he know that the same pink color was painted on Tj’s cheeks.

“Of course, Underdog.”

Cyrus smiled, and moved closer to Tj while not facing him. Tj put him arms around Cyrus waist so that they were spooning, and Tj prayed that Cyrus couldn’t feel how fast his heart was beating in his chest. They stayed in that position for the rest of the night, and Cyrus managed to get through it without a single nightmare.

Tj was quick to assure him that he didn’t think of him that way. “Cyrus, crying does not make you a baby, it makes you brave. I don’t ever want you to feel like you have to hide stuff from me, nothing can make me think any differently of you.”

Cyrus couldn’t help but break out into a huge grin at that, and for a little while, they just faced each other and examined every part of the other’s face, a comfortable silence filling the room.

After a while, Tj broke the silence. “I look up to you and admire you so much, you know that, right?” He almost regretted saying it as soon as the words left his mouth, but he realized that there was no point in hiding it. After all, it was true.

“You do?”

“Well, yeah. Just thought you should know. I feel like people don’t tell you that enough.”

After another moment of silence, Cyrus felt his screw it instincts kick in and he decided to do something he’d longed for for a long time. He leaned forward and closed the gap between him and Tj by pressing his lips against his. At first, Tj was caught off guard, but as soon as he realized what was happening, he happily melted into the kiss. As soon as they broke apart, both boys smiled at each other.

“Woah.” Was all that Tj managed to get out.

“I’ve wanted to do that for a while now.” Cyrus shyly admitted. Tj couldn’t quite comprehend what was happening, as he was too focused on not letting out a scream of excitement ,“Well, I’m glad you did, because so have I.”

“You might as well kiss me again, then.” Cyrus said through a huge grin. Tj, who was smiling just as big, leaned in and pressed his lips against Cyrus’ now familiar ones.

As they parted, Cyrus let out a little laugh. Tj furrowed his eyebrows and looked at him questioningly. “That’s not quite the outcome I expected from having nightmares.” Cyrus said and chuckled. Tj did the same, because this was really not how he expected their sleepover to end. Cyrus yawned, and Tj noticed that he was quite tired, too. They’d both woken up in the middle of the night, so it was no surprise that they were sleepy.

“Are you okay to go back to sleep?” Tj asked, to which Cyrus nodded. Cyrus hesitated before asking “Tj? Can you… um, hold me?” He was happy that the lights were off, so Tj couldn’t see the blush spreading across his cheeks. Little did he know that the same pink color was painted on Tj’s cheeks.

“Of course, Underdog.”

Cyrus smiled, and moved closer to Tj while not facing him. Tj put him arms around Cyrus waist so that they were spooning, and Tj prayed that Cyrus couldn’t feel how fast his heart was beating in his chest. They stayed in that position for the rest of the night, and Cyrus managed to get through it without a single nightmare.

He’d always found it annoying, waking up at times when he didn’t want to, and never managing to go back to sleep, So, it didn’t take much for Tj to wake up at 3am one night when he heard silent sobs coming from the mattress on the floor.

Cyrus was spending the night at Tj’s, which had become quite a tradition for the two. They’d always stay up late and play games, watch movies and talk about everything between heaven and earth (with a few exceptions of course, Tj never mentioned his heart-aching, painful, unrequited crush on the other boy). His favorite part about the sleepovers had always been watching movies, because if he was lucky, Cyrus would get tired and slowly but surely get closer to Tj. In the end, he’d be leaning against Tj completely with his head on his shoulder and their legs intertwined. It was almost like cuddling, and Tj secretly adored it.

As soon as Tj came to his senses, he realized that Cyrus was crying. Feeling panic spread to his body, he whispered a quiet “Hey, Cyrus.”, and awaited an answer. Cyrus turned around to face Tj, and even in the dark, Tj could see Cyrus’ teary eyes.

“Sorry, I didn’t mean to wake you.” He whispered back, probably thinking that he had annoyed Tj by waking him up in the middle of the night. Tj, on the other hand, was just concerned for the other boy’s feelings. He immediately shook his head, not wanting Cyrus to think that he was being a burden.

“Cyrus, no, it’s fine. Is everything okay?” He asked, voice soft and caring. “I heard you crying, I don’t want you to be upset.” Cyrus managed to smile, and sniffled before answering, “Yeah, I’m okay. I just had a nightmare, that’s all.”

“Do you want to talk about it? You know I’m a great listener.”

“Not really, it was just a normal nightmare. Thanks though.”

Before Tj could think, he lifted up his duvet and motioned for Cyrus lay next to him. As soon as his mind caught up with his body though, he had an internal panic attack because what was he doing? He faked a cough and tried to explain himself, “I mean, you could lay here, if you want. Only if you want to, though. But I was thinking that you might feel safer up here?
